annotation.text: In isolated rat cardiomyocytes and Stro-1 stem cells, HBR enhanced the transcription of vascular endothelial growth factor, hepatocyte growth factor, kdr, akt, and pim-1.
In isolated rat cardiomyocytes and Stro-1 stem cells, HBR enhanced the transcription of vascular endothelial growth factor, hepatocyte growth factor, kdr, akt, and pim-1.

D, the number of Ki-67-positive cells significantly increased in the HBR-treated animals (arrows);
Immunohistochemical analysis of vWF expression revealed that the density of capillary vessels was significantly increased at the infarct border zone of animals injected with HBR,
after 24 h, a significant increase in Ki-67 expression was found in the examined sections from HBR-injected animals,
VEGF cytoplasmic expression also significantly increased in the cardiomyocytes following HBR injection (Fig. 4F).
Real-time PCR analysis revealed that in vitro exposure to HBR of both RCm and rat Stro-1-positive stem cells significantly enhanced the gene expression of VEGF, kdr

Real-time PCR analysis revealed that in vitro exposure to HBR of both RCm and rat Stro-1-positive stem cells significantly enhanced the gene expression of VEGF, kdr (encoding a major VEGF receptor), HGF, akt, and pim-1
In RCm, HBR-mediated stimulation of pim-1 gene expression occurred in a time-dependent, biphasic fashion.
Increased pim-1 mRNA was detected within 24 h after HBR stimulation and then declined toward basal values after 3 days.
A second elevation in pim-1 gene expression was observed after 6 days of RCm exposure to the mixed ester (Fig. 5A).
Real-time PCR analysis revealed that in vitro exposure to HBR of both RCm and rat Stro-1-positive stem cells significantly enhanced the gene expression of VEGF, kdr

The HBR treatment enhanced the secretion of VEGF and HGF in the culture medium from both RCm and Stro-1 cells.
The HBR treatment enhanced the secretion of VEGF and HGF in the culture medium from both RCm and Stro-1 cells.
The amount of VEGF released by Stro-1 cells was slightly increased by BU but not HA alone,
Fig. 7 shows that nuclei isolated from HBR-treated Stro-1-positive cells exhibited a consistent increase in the transcription rate of VEGF and pim-1 genes,

The observation that exposure of RCm and Stro-1 cells to HBR increased VEGF, HGF, akt, and pim-1 gene expression may have further relevant implications.
The observation that exposure of RCm and Stro-1 cells to HBR increased VEGF, HGF, akt, and pim-1 gene expression may have further relevant implications.
The observation that exposure of RCm and Stro-1 cells to HBR increased VEGF, HGF, akt, and pim-1 gene expression may have further relevant implications.
The observation that exposure of RCm and Stro-1 cells to HBR increased VEGF, HGF, akt, and pim-1 gene expression may have further relevant implications.
Here, we show that in RCm pim-1 gene expression was augmented in a biphasic manner by the addition of HBR.
Up-regulation of both akt and pim-1 gene expression in HBR-treated Stro-1 cells is also worthy of consideration,
Up-regulation of both akt and pim-1 gene expression in HBR-treated Stro-1 cells is also worthy of consideration,
The finding that VEGF secretion from these cells was significantly higher in the presence of HBR,

To this end, nuclear run-off experiments indicate that the action of HBR was mediated at the transcriptional level and that although the transcription rate of VEGF and pim-1 was unaffected following nuclear exposure to HBR, it was conversely enhanced by BU and RA with superimposable time courses and additive effects.

To this end, nuclear run-off experiments indicate that the action of HBR was mediated at the transcriptional level and that although the transcription rate of VEGF and pim-1 was unaffected following nuclear exposure to HBR, it was conversely enhanced by BU and RA with superimposable time courses and additive effects.

To this end, nuclear run-off experiments indicate that the action of HBR was mediated at the transcriptional level and that although the transcription rate of VEGF and pim-1 was unaffected following nuclear exposure to HBR, it was conversely enhanced by BU and RA with superimposable time courses and additive effects.

To this end, nuclear run-off experiments indicate that the action of HBR was mediated at the transcriptional level and that although the transcription rate of VEGF and pim-1 was unaffected following nuclear exposure to HBR, it was conversely enhanced by BU and RA with superimposable time courses and additive effects.
